message.content:
cs.IT, cs.NI, cs.SI, cs.DS, cs.CC. 

The paper deals with the reliability of a network employing Random Linear Network Coding, which is a technique used in information theory. Therefore, cs.IT (Information Theory) is the most likely sub-category. The paper also deals with networking and communication, which suggests cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture) and cs.SI (Social and Information Networks) as likely sub-categories. The paper proposes a novel upper bound, which involves mathematical analysis, indicating cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) as a possible sub-category. Finally, the paper discusses the throughput gain of the proposed scheme, which suggests cs.CC (Computational Complexity) as a possible sub-category.
